Description: Ivory disc, probably the lid of a tubular-shaped box such as a cosmetic holder; one side, probably the outer surface, is slightly chamfered on the edges; the other has a narrow groove running around the outer lip, possibly to fit into the vessel beneath; a small hole has been perforated into the centre of the top side, a similar depression occurs on the other side but the two holes do not connect through; the surface of the disc is worn.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
